theoryTitle: Noah and Joy Boy's Promise Will Be Fulfilled by Luffy
theoryText: The Noah ship appearing in this episode is connected to Joy Boy's ancient promise to bring the fish-men and merfolk to the surface. The theory suggests that Luffy, as the next 'Joy Boy,' will eventually fulfill this promise. When Luffy finds the One Piece and the final war breaks out, he will guide Shirahoshi (Poseidon) to use her power to control the Sea Kings, who will lift Noah and transport all fish-men and merfolk to the surface world, finally completing Joy Boy's 800-year-old promise.
author: Multiple One Piece theorists
supportingEvidence: Madam Shyarly's prophecy about someone with a straw hat destroying Fish-Man Island
Joy Boy's apology on the Poneglyph for breaking his promise
Shirahoshi's identity as the ancient weapon Poseidon with power to command Sea Kings
Noah's massive size being able to carry the entire population of Fish-Man Island
The theory about the Red Line being destroyed would make Fish-Man Island uninhabitable

theoryTitle: Fish-Man Island's Destruction and the Red Line
theoryText: The appearance of Noah on a collision course with Fish-Man Island in this episode connects to the larger theory about the destruction of Fish-Man Island. The theory posits that when the Red Line is eventually destroyed (likely during the final war), Fish-Man Island, which sits directly beneath it, will also be destroyed. This would fulfill Madam Shyarly's prophecy about Luffy destroying the island. However, this won't be a tragedy because Luffy will have already used Noah to evacuate all inhabitants to the surface, finally achieving the integration of fish-men and humans that has been denied for centuries.
author: Various r/OnePiece theorists
supportingEvidence: Fish-Man Island's location directly under the Red Line
Madam Shyarly's prophecy about Luffy destroying the island
The recurring theme of breaking down barriers between races
Noah's purpose as a ship to transport fish-men to the surface
Joy Boy's connection to both the ancient weapons and the Final War

theoryTitle: General Franky as Precursor to Ancient Kingdom Technology
theoryText: The debut of General Franky in this episode represents Franky's assimilation of Dr. Vegapunk's technology. Some theorists suggest that this technology has roots in the Ancient Kingdom's advanced civilization. Franky's ability to create such sophisticated machinery from Vegapunk's blueprints hints that the Ancient Kingdom may have had similar or even more advanced mecha and weapons. This could tie into the ancient weapons (Pluton, Poseidon, Uranus) and suggest that advanced technology played a role in the Void Century war.
author: One Piece technology theorists
supportingEvidence: Franky studied Vegapunk's research for two years
Vegapunk's technology is repeatedly shown to be far ahead of the current era
The ancient weapon Pluton is also a ship/weapon design
Wapometal (used in General Franky) is a special alloy with unique properties
The Ancient Kingdom was known for advanced technology
